name: places/ChIJ_8yemxFawokR8zxUprhv1AQ
formattedAddress: 20 West St, New York, NY 10281, USA
adrFormatAddress: 20 West St, New York, NY 10281, USA

originalText.text:
Leaving another review as the negative reviews are completely inaccurate as of January 29th, 2022 and also a bit ignorant of NYC law.

I've lived in the building for four years. Yes, DURING THE PANDEMIC, the gym and other amenities were closed (as they were in other buildings). They are open now and recently renovated. DUE TO NYC LAW REQUIRING FACADE WORK, the building's outdoor spaces were closed over the past year and change as there were scaffolds up across the building for inspection and repair. They are all open again and you have some of the best views in NYC (pictures attached from late last year, when the outdoor spaces reopened).

Having to do a five-year inspection and repair is a requirement for every NYC building every five years. The pandemic hitting during the same time as the legally-required inspections and repairs made it take a few months longer, which was unfortunate. To act as if this was a permanent situation is so stupid, not really sure what else to say.

Next time ask the virus to reschedule, maybe?

Personally, I find the staff quite pleasant, but sounds like a couple people have an axe to grind? They always help me out, and I've never seen them make anyone wait for service.

originalText.text:
Building staff are great for the most part. Neighbors some great and some terribly noisy. Gym and common areas are incredible and meticulously maintained (Need a functioning water fountain in gym and the saunas/steam room have been out of service for years - which was a huge selling point so not sure why it was never fixed).

What is very frustrating, and of course this is beyond the scope of the building staff, is the lack of attractive women in the building. I mean, it's actually dumfounding how beat the non-males are in this condominium. You go to the gym all excited to get a pump in front some babes (at the very least some humble 6's) and all you ever get are these asperger, overweight, half blind lards stumbling on the treadmill...what am I dropping on this condo for?

Anyhow, I think maintaining friendly service and for the staff professionals to keep doing what they're doing makes this one of the best buildings in downtown - there's no doubt about it.

I am satisfied with the purchase of my unit here, sans the sauna/steam room.
